prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: Another lawyer at the office. He's passionate about the law, and hates anything that's not fair or just.
Character 1
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: Our client in this case. We've been friends since childhood. A sweet girl who loves nature.
Character 2
Name: Candice Arme
Description: The victim in this case. A detective who was heading up the investigation into a bombing incident.
Character 3
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: A young, rookie lawyer at our agency. She's also our client's friend.
Character 4
Name: Gaspen Payne
Description: The prosecuting attorney. He just seems to exude unpleasantness...
Character 5
Name: Ted Tonate
Description: A police bomb specialist. He was in charge of handling the bomb that exploded in the courtroom.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My brand-new, shiny badge. It shows that I'm a defense attorney.* (when playing as Athena Cykes) It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)
Evidence 1
Name: Arme's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Trauma to back of head caused by impact with a flat object. Time of death: Between 8 and 11 AM.
Evidence 2
Name: HH-3000 Bomb
Description: The time bomb that destroyed the courtroom. It was hidden inside a stuffed animal when it was detonated. It was hidden inside a stuffed animal and can be detonated remotely.
Evidence 3
Name: Phony Phanty Tail
Description: A piece of the stuffed animal that the bomb was inserted into. The defendant's fingerprints were found on it.
Evidence 4
Name: Bomb Transport Case
Description: The case Tonate and Detective Arme transported the bomb in. Tonate has the key.
Evidence 5
Name: Missing Remote Switch
Description: A switch that starts the time bomb's countdown. It was stolen just before the blast and is now missing.
Evidence 6
Name: Courtroom No. 4 Diagram
Description: A diagram of the courtroom as it was when Apollo was discovered after the assault. [caption] The rubble blocks off access to the area around the witness stand.
Evidence 7
Name: Apollo's Assault Photo
Description: Apollo is shown collapsed on the floor. The bloody writing is also visible. [caption] The writing is "L10015."
Evidence 8
Name: Courtroom Bombing Photo
Description: Crime scene photo of the aftermath of the Courtroom No. 4 bombing and the victim. [caption] The victim sits in front of some sharp and pointed rubbles. There is blood on the victim's head trickling down.
Evidence 9
Name: Bloody Writing Analysis
Description: A report that proves that the writing was done in Detective Arme's blood. [caption] The writing is "L10015."
Evidence 10
Name: Mr. Wright's Last Will
Description: "Apollo, sorry I got you caught up in all this. I leave the rest to you. Take good care of everyone, okay?"
Evidence 11
Name: Mr. Wright's Cell Phone
Description: The phone that delivered Mr. Wright's final message to me.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: THE BOMB WAS ORIGINALLY DISARMED BY ME, THEN TRANSPORTED HERE AS EVIDENCE.
Person: Tonate
Testimony 1
Testimony: BOMB NAME: HH-3000 OPERATED BY TIMER OR WITH A REMOTE
Person: Tonate
Testimony 2
Testimony: I WAS WATCHING FROM THE GALLERY WHEN I SUDDENLY BECAME ALARMED.
Person: Tonate
Testimony 3
Testimony: I SAW THAT THE BOMB'S TIMER WAS COUNTING DOWN.
Person: Tonate

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's go through the evidence and testimonies step by step.

First, I'll look at the evidence provided. There are several pieces, but I'm particularly interested in the ones related to the bomb and its detonation. Evidence 2 mentions the HH-3000 Bomb, which was hidden inside a stuffed animal and detonated. Evidence 3 is the Phony Phanty Tail, part of the stuffed animal with the defendant's fingerprints. Evidence 5 is the Missing Remote Switch that starts the bomb's countdown. The testimony from Tonate says that he disarmed the bomb, transported it, and found the timer counting down. 

Wait, Tonate's testimony says he disarmed the bomb. But if he disarmed it, why did it detonate? That seems contradictory. Maybe he didn't actually disarm it properly, which led to the explosion. 

Looking at the evidence, the bomb was hidden in a stuffed animal and detonated. Tonate says he disarmed it but found the timer counting down. If he disarmed it, the timer should have been stopped. But if the timer was still counting down, that means he didn't fully disarm it. 

So, the testimony that he disarmed the bomb contradicts the evidence that the bomb detonated because the timer was still counting down. That means he didn't actually disarm it properly, leading to the explosion.

Therefore, the evidence (the bomb detonated) and testimony (Tonate disarmed it) contradict each other.
</think>

cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's see, the evidence is about the HH-3000 Bomb. It says the bomb was hidden inside a stuffed animal and can be detonated remotely. The testimony is from Ted Tonate, the police bomb specialist, who claims he was watching from the gallery when he became alarmed and saw the bomb's timer counting down. 

Wait, if the bomb was hidden inside a stuffed animal and could be detonated remotely, but the testimony says Tonate saw the timer counting down, implying he was present at the scene. But if the bomb was hidden, maybe Tonate couldn't have seen the timer because it was inside the stuffed animal. That seems contradictory because if the bomb was inside the stuffed animal, it wouldn't be visible, so Tonate couldn't have seen the timer. 

So, the evidence about the bomb being hidden inside a stuffed animal and the testimony about seeing the timer counting down contradict each other because the bomb's location makes it impossible to see the timer. 

The correct answer should be {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 0}.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem. I'm presented with a list of characters, evidence, and testimonies related to a court case. My task is to identify which piece of evidence contradicts a testimony. 

First, I'll go through each piece of evidence and testimony to understand their content and context. 

Looking at the evidence list:
- Evidence 0: Attorney's Badge
- Evidence 1: Arme's Autopsy Report
- Evidence 2: HH-3000 Bomb
- Evidence 3: Phony Phanty Tail
- Evidence 4: Bomb Transport Case
- Evidence 5: Missing Remote Switch
- Evidence 6: Courtroom No. 4 Diagram
- Evidence 7: Apollo's Assault Photo
- Evidence 8: Courtroom Bombing Photo
- Evidence 9: Bloody Writing Analysis
- Evidence 10: Mr. Wright's Last Will
- Evidence 11: Mr. Wright's Cell Phone

Testimonies:
- Testimony 0: Tonate's statements about the bombing scene
- Testimony 1: Tonate's denial of the blood writing
- Testimony 2: Tonate's claim about Arme's position
- Testimony 3: Tonate's assertion about the lack of writing
- Testimony 4: Tonate's denial of the blood evidence

I need to find a contradiction between an evidence and a testimony. For example, if a testimony claims something happened that contradicts what the evidence shows.

Looking at the evidence and testimonies, I notice that Testimony 0 says Tonate was the first on the scene and there was no bloody writing. However, Evidence 7 shows a photo with bloody writing. This seems contradictory.

So, the evidence and testimony that contradict each other are:
- Evidence 7: Apollo's Assault Photo showing bloody writing.
- Testimony 0: Tonate claims there was no bloody writing at the scene.
</think>

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: IT IS TRUE THAT DETECTIVE ARME WROTE MY ID NUMBER.
Person: Tonate
Testimony 1
Testimony: SHE VERY PLAINLY WROTE "L10015R." I WAS SHOCKED.
Person: Tonate
Testimony 2
Testimony: BUT I DID NOT DETONATE THE BOMB.
Person: Tonate
Testimony 3
Testimony: DETECTIVE ARME MUST HAVE MISTAKEN ME FOR THE REAL BOMBER.

cot:
Alright, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by looking at the evidence and testimonies provided.

First, I'll go through the evidence list to understand what each piece of evidence is about. Evidence 1 is the Autopsy Report of Candice Arme, which states that she died from a head injury caused by a flat object between 8 and 11 AM. Evidence 2 describes the HH-3000 Bomb, which was hidden inside a stuffed animal and detonated remotely. Evidence 3 is the Phony Phanty Tail, part of the stuffed animal with the defendant's fingerprints. Evidence 4 is the Bomb Transport Case, which Tonate has the key to. Evidence 5 mentions the Missing Remote Switch that started the bomb's countdown. Evidence 6 is the Courtroom No. 4 Diagram showing the rubble blocking access near the witness stand. Evidence 7 is the Apollo's Assault Photo with the victim's blood writing "L10015." Evidence 8 is the Courtroom Bombing Photo showing the victim with blood on her head. Evidence 9 is the Bloody Writing Analysis confirming the writing was in Arme's blood. Evidence 10 is Mr. Wright's Last Will. Evidence 11 is Mr. Wright's Cell Phone.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Tonate claims he was the first on the scene and there was no bloody writing. He also says the victim was too far from where the message was found.

I need to find a contradiction between an evidence and a testimony. Looking at Evidence 1 (Arme's Autopsy Report) and Testimony 0 (Tonate's statement). The report says Arme died from a head injury between 8 and 11 AM. Tonate claims he moved the body and covered the writing. This suggests the body was moved, contradicting the evidence that the writing was in Arme's blood.

So, the contradiction is between Evidence 1 and Testimony 0.
</think>
